metadata: (info { (description "This game is depicted in a fresco from the Sogdian city of Panjikent. The board as depicted consists of three rows of twelve squares, which are divided in half by a wide rectangle.") (rules "Three rows of twelve squares, whice are divided in half by a large rectangle. Two players.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "894") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/war/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Sogdia, around 740.") } ) (graphics { (board Colour Phase0 (colour 223 178 110)) (board Colour InnerEdges (colour Black)) (board Colour OuterEdges (colour Black)) })
